member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Page for a page object.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the immediate parent of this page object.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.LastModified
member.summary: (Required if PieceInfo is present; optional otherwise; PDF 1.3) The date and time when the pages contents were most recently modified. If a page-piece dictionary (PieceInfo) is present, the modification date is used to ascertain which of the application data dictionaries that it contains correspond to the current content of the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.BleedBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.TrimBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.ArtBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the extent of the pages meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the pages creator. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.BoxColorInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A box color information dictionary specifying the colors and other visual characteristics to be used in displaying guidelines on the screen for the various page boundaries. If this entry is absent, the application should use its own current default settings.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Optional) A content stream describing the contents of this page. If this entry is absent, the page is empty. The value may be either a single stream or an array of streams. If the value is an array, the effect is as if all of the streams in the array were concatenated, in order, to form a single stream. This allows PDF producers to create gdiImage objects and other resources as they occur, even though they interrupt the content stream. The division between streams may occur only at the boundaries between lexical tokens but is unrelated to the pages logical content or organization. Applications that consume or produce PDF files are not required to preserve the existing structure of the Contents array.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary specifying the attributes of the pages page group for use in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Thumb
member.summary: (Optional) A stream object defining the pages thumbnail gdiImage.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.B
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; recommended if the page contains article beads) An array of indirect references to article beads appearing on the page. The beads are listed in the array in natural reading order.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Dur
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The pages display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page is displayed during presentations before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page. By default, the viewer does not advance automatically.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Trans
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A transition dictionary describing the transition effect to be used when displaying the page during presentations.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Annots
member.summary: (Optional) An array of annotation dictionaries representing annotations associated with the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining actions to be performed when the page is opened or closed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.PieceInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A page-piece dictionary associated with the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.StructParents
member.summary: (Required if the page contains structural content items; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the pages entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the pages parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.PZ
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The pages preferred zoom (magnification) factor: the factor by which it should be scaled to achieve the natural display magnification.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.SeparationInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A separation dictionary containing information needed to generate color separations for the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.Tabs
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A name specifying the tab order to be used for annotations on the page. The possible values are R (row order), C (column order), and S (structure order).

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.TemplateInstantiated
member.summary: (Required if this page was created from a named page object; PDF 1.5) The name of the originating page object.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.PresSteps
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A navigation node dictionary representing the first node on the page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.UserUnit
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) A positive number giving the size of default user space units, in multiples of 1/72 inch. The range of supported values is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.Keys.VP
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) An array of viewport dictionaries specifying rectangular regions of the page.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.summary: Predefined keys common to PdfPageDictionary and PdfPagesDictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.InheritablePageKeys.Resources
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A dictionary containing any resources required by the page. If the page requires no resources, the value of this entry should be an empty dictionary. Omitting the entry entirely indicates that the resources are to be inherited from an ancestor node in the page tree.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.InheritablePageKeys.MediaBox
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is intended to be displayed or printed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.InheritablePageKeys.CropBox
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the visible region of default user space. When the page is displayed or printed, its contents are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium in some implementationdefined manner. Default value: the value of MediaBox.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfPageDictionary.InheritablePageKeys.Rotate
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The number of degrees by which the page should be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value must be a multiple of 90. Default value: 0.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.Length
member.summary: (Required) The number of bytes from the beginning of the line following the keyword stream to the last byte just before the keywordendstream. (There may be an additional EOL marker, preceding endstream, that is not included in the count and is not logically part of the stream data.)

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the stream data found between the keywords stream and endstream, or an array of such names. Multiple filters should be specified in the order in which they are to be applied.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.DecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional) A parameter dictionary or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by Filter. If there is only one filter and that filter has parameters, DecodeParms must be set to the filters parameter dictionary unless all the filters parameters have their default values, in which case the DecodeParms entry may be omitted. If there are multiple filters and any of the filters has parameters set to nondefault values, DecodeParms must be an array with one entry for each filter: either the parameter dictionary for that filter, or the null object if that filter has no parameters (or if all of its parameters have their default values). If none of the filters have parameters, or if all their parameters have default values, the DecodeParms entry may be omitted.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.F
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The file containing the stream data. If this entry is present, the bytes between stream and endstream are ignored, the filters are specified by FFilter rather than Filter, and the filter parameters are specified by FDecodeParms rather than DecodeParms. However, the Length entry should still specify the number of those bytes. (Usually, there are no bytes and Length is 0.)

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.FFilter
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the data found in the streams external file, or an array of such names. The same rules apply as for Filter.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.FDecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A parameter dictionary, or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by FFilter. The same rules apply as for DecodeParms.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.Keys.DL
member.summary: Optional; PDF 1.5) A non-negative integer representing the number of bytes in the decoded (defiltered) stream. It can be used to determine, for example, whether enough disk space is available to write a stream to a file. This value should be considered a hint only; for some stream filters, it may not be possible to determine this value precisely.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.EmbeddedFontFileKeys.Length1
member.summary: (Required for Type 1 and TrueType fonts) The length in bytes of the clear-text portion of the Type 1 font program (see below), or the entire TrueType font program, after it has been decoded using the filters specified by the streams Filter entry, if any.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.EmbeddedFontFileKeys.Length2
member.summary: (Required for Type 1 fonts) The length in bytes of the encrypted portion of the Type 1 font program (see below) after it has been decoded using the filters specified by the streams Filter entry.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.EmbeddedFontFileKeys.Length3
member.summary: (Required for Type 1 fonts) The length in bytes of the fixed-content portion of the Type 1 font program (see below) after it has been decoded using the filters specified by the streams Filter entry. If Length3 is 0, it indicates that the 512 zeros and cleartomark have not been included in the FontFile font program and must be added.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.EmbeddedFontFileKeys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required if referenced from FontFile3; PDF 1.2) A name specifying the format of the embedded font program. The name must be Type1C for Type 1 compact fonts, CIDFontType0C for Type 0 compact CIDFonts, or OpenType for OpenType fonts. When additional font formats are added to PDF, more values will be defined for Subtype.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfStream.EmbeddedFontFileKeys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the embedded font program (see Section 10.2.2, Metadata Streams).

member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The catalog dictionary for the PDF document contained in the file.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.Size
member.summary: (Required; must not be an indirect reference) The total number of entries in the files cross-reference table, as defined by the combination of the original section and all update sections. Equivalently, this value is 1 greater than the highest object number used in the file. Note: Any object in a cross-reference section whose number is greater than this value is ignored and considered missing.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.Prev
member.summary: (Present only if the file has more than one cross-reference section; must not be an indirect reference) The byte offset from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the previous cross-reference section.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.Root
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The catalog dictionary for the PDF document contained in the file.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.Encrypt
member.summary: (Required if document is encrypted; PDF 1.1) The documents encryption dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.Info
member.summary: (Optional; must be an indirect reference) The documents information dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional, but strongly recommended; PDF 1.1) An array of two strings constituting a file identifier for the file. Although this entry is optional, its absence might prevent the file from functioning in some workflows that depend on files being uniquely identified.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTrailerDictionary.Keys.XRefStm
member.summary: (Optional) The byte offset from the beginning of the file of a cross-reference stream.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of PdfTransparencyDictionary with default transparency values.

member.summary: Predefined keys for this dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTransparencyDictionary.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Group for a group XObject.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTransparencyDictionary.Keys.S
member.summary: (Required) The group subtype, which identifies the type of group whose attributes this dictionary describes; must be Transparency for a transparency group.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTransparencyDictionary.Keys.CS
F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTransparencyDictionary.Keys.I
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether the transparency group is isolated. If this flag is true, objects within the group are composited against a fully transparent initial backdrop; if false, they are composited against the groups backdrop. The default value is false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfTransparencyDictionary.Keys.K
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether the transparency group is a knockout group. If this flag is false, later objects within the group are composited with earlier ones with which they overlap; if true, they are composited with the groups initial backdrop and overwrite any earlier overlapping objects. The default value is false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.HideMenubar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications menu bar when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.HideWindowUI
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the documents window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the documents contents displayed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.FitWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to resize the documents window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.CenterWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to position the documents window in the center of the screen. Default value: false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: (Optional; PDF1.4) A flag specifying whether the windows title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary (see Section 10.2.1, Document Information Dictionary). If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.Direction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF1.3) The predominant reading order for text: L2R Left to right R2L Right to left (including vertical writing systems, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) This entry has no direct effect on the documents contents or page numbering but can be used to determine the relative positioning of pages when displayed side by side or printed n-up. Default value: L2R.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferencesDictionary.Keys.RenderToolTips
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to render the text annotations that are generated to represent tooltips. Default value: False.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how many columns are present in the of the report.
member.value: An integer value specifying the number of columns. The value should be equal to or greater than 1. The default is 1.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.Padding
member.summary: Represents padding information associated with a report item.

remarks.para: The padding is the internal space between the body of the item and its edge.

Padding has a different effect on report items that are containers than on report items that are not. For example, in a item, the Padding property defines the spacing between the border of the Panel and its child items. For a item, the Padding property defines the spacing between the border of the TextBox item and its contained text.

Multi-column reports are primarily used for printing labels.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.PictureWatermark
member.summary: Represents a picture watermark on a printable page.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.PictureWatermark.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image of the watermark to be printed on the page.
member.value: The image of the watermark to be printed on the page.
member.remarks: The specified image can be in one of the following supported formats: an object instance inherited from ; an array of bytes containing binary image data; a local file path (relative or absolute) or an URL to an external image file. Instead of providing the image directly, it is possible to specify it indirectly as an expression that gets evaluated at runtime for each printable page. The result of the evaluation should be of one of the support types enumerated above. If the image is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), or if the specified expression evaluates to null (Nothing in Visual Basic), the watermark is not printed on the current page.
member.example:
The following expression prints a watermark on every second page:
= IIf(PageNumber % 2 = 0, "Watermark.png", Null)

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.PictureWatermark.Sizing
member.summary: Gets or sets the sizing mode of the watermark image on the printable page.
member.value: A value that specifies the sizing mode of the watermark image on the printable page.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.TextWatermark
member.summary: Represents a text watermark on a printable page.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.TextWatermark.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the watermark to be printed on the page.
member.value: A started with "=" is interpreted as an expression to calculate the real data, otherwise - literal string. Supports embedded expressions also.
member.remarks: The text can be specified either directly as a string literal or indirectly as an expression that is evaluated at runtime for each printable page. If the text is null (Nothing in Visual Basic) or an empty string, or if the specified expression evaluates to null (Nothing in Visual Basic) or an empty string, the watermark is not printed on the current page.
member.example:
The following expression prints a watermark on every second page:
= IIf(PageNumber % 2 = 0, "Watermark", Null)

member.value: A value that specifies the orientation of the watermark text on the printable page.

member.value: A value that specifies the font settings of the watermark text.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.UnitType
member.summary: Represents the type of a .

remarks.para: 1 inch = 6 picas = 72 points.
1 centimeter = 10 millimeters.
Pixels convert to and from other units based on the dpi of the current graphics context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.Watermark.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the watermark relative to the other items on the printable page.
member.value: A value that specifies the position of the watermark relative to the other items on the printable page.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Drawing.Watermark.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the watermark when combining it with the other items on the printable page.
member.value: A value that specifies the opacity of the watermark when combining it with the other items on the printable page.
member.remarks: The value can be specified in the range from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is completely transparent, while 1.0 is completely opaque. Any other value outside that range is clamped to the closest allowed value.

member.summary: The attribute is used only in WebReportDesigner JSON serialization. Specifies a property that needs to be serialized again under different name. Example: PictureBox's Value property contains the expression or path to load the image. When it contains bas64 image data, it is serialized in Image property.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.ErrorEventArgs

member.remarks: A object is passed to the event handler, which allows you to determine the current exception that has occurred during the report processing and to indicate that the report operation should be canceled. To cancel the report operation, set the ErrorEventArgs.Cancel property to True.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Filter.Value
member.summary: If the Value starts with the equal (=) sign, it will be evaluated as an expression otherwise - as string value. For ex. if the value is 7 it is interpreted as the string "7"; To compare a numeric expression with the number 7, use the expression syntax which begins with the equal sign: =7.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale
member.summary: A graph axis scale that displays dates in chronological order at specific intervals, or base units, even if the dates from the data source are not in order or in the same base units.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.BaseUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the base unit for the current DateTimeScale. The base unit defines the interval between the points on the axis. By default the base units are according to the smallest difference between any two dates in the data.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.MinorUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit for the interval/step between the minor ticks/grid lines. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the minor ticks and minor grid lines, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.MinorStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the step/interval for the minor ticks/grid lines. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the minor ticks and minor grid lines, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.MajorUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit for the interval/step between the major ticks/grid lines. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the major ticks and major grid lines, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.MajorStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the step/interval between the major ticks/grid lines. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the major ticks and major grid lines, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.LabelUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit for the interval/step between the labels. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the labels on the axis, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.LabelStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the step/interval between the labels. In conjunction with the property defines the interval between the labels on the axis, ex.: 1 day, 3 months, 1 year. The property is applied only when is set to a value other than Auto.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the current axis.
member.value: A DateTime value that is the minimum value of the scale's range. The default value is null.
member.remarks: When the Minimum property is set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic) then the minimum value of the scale's range is defined by the data. In case there are no data points available then the Minimum value is set according to and the selected . In case the Maximum and Minimum values are set to an equal value, then their values are ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.DateTimeScale.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for the current axis.
member.value: A DateTime value that is the maximum value of the scale's range. The default value is null.
member.remarks: When the Maximum property is set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic) then the maximum value of the scale's range is defined by the data. In case there are no data points available then the Maximum value is set according to and the selected . In case the Maximum and Minimum values are set to an equal value, then their values are ignored.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.LogarithmicScale
member.summary: The LogarithmicScale is similar to the , except there's a logarithmic transform that is applied to the input domain value before the output range value is computed. The mapping to the output range value y can be expressed as a function of the input domain value x: y = m log(x) + b. The LogarithmicScale does not support zero or negative values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.LogarithmicScale.Base
member.summary: Gets or sets the base value of the logarithm.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.LogarithmicScale.Minimum
member.summary: Axis' minimum value. Set to float.NaN to automatically calculate the value based on the data.
member.remarks: Due to the nature of the logarithmic transformation applied to the scale the Minimum property accepts only positive numbers and throws an error for zero or negative values.
member.value: A positive number that defines the minimum value for the scale. A value indicates that the scale will automatically calculate its minimum value based on the data. The default value is .

members.member:
Graph axis range - maximum value. Set to float.NaN to automatically calculate the value based on the data.
Due to the nature of the logarithmic transformation applied to the scale the Maximum property accepts only positive numbers and throws an error for zero or negative values.
A positive number that indicates the maximum value for the scale.
A positive number that defines the maximum value for the scale. A value indicates that the scale will automatically calculate its maximum value based on the data. The default value is . [MergableProperty(true)]

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.GraphSeries
member.summary: Represents a series of data points with labels in the report item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GraphSeries.ArrangeByAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis/direction that the is applied to.
member.remarks:
This property is applicable if the ArrangeMode is set to Stacked or Stacked100; otherwise it is ignored.
Use the ArrangeByAxis property to specify how the series will be arranged (stacked) at runtime. By default the Graph item always stacks the series by the axis with the Numeric scale (including LogarithmicScale and ExponentialScale).
If a series is to be projected on a coordinate system with a combination of NumericScale/CategoryScale or NumericScale/DateTimeScale, and the series has an ArrangeMode set to Stacked or Stacked100, the series will always be stacked by the value projected on the NumericScale, no matter if this is X/Y/Angular or Radial axis.
In the case a series is to be projected on a coordinate system where both axes are NumercScales you can choose how you want to stack the series values. If no axis is specified, the default is the X axis (in CartesianCoordinateSytem) or the Angular axis (in the case of PolarCooordinateSystem).

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.ThresholdMode
member.summary: Represents the behavior when determining which data points to get merged.
member.remarks: Each mode requires accompanying threshold number in specific range. To compare and order the data points each data point gets associated with a value. This value gets evaluated from appropriate definition expression. For example, the data points value expression is the expression ( when no X is available).

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.ThresholdMode.Count
member.summary: The threshold value should be an integer number determining how many data points should be presented on their own (without being merged) at most. The data points are first ordered by their value. All data points appearing after the count of points determined by the threshold value get merged. For example, in a set of 10 data points and threshold value of 3, all but the top 3 data points will get merged.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.ThresholdMode.PercentageCount
member.summary: The threshold value should be a decimal or integer number between 0 and 100 and represents a percentage of the count of the data points that should be presented on their own (without being merged). The data points are first ordered by their value. Then the count of the data points that are not merged is calculated as a percentage of all data points count. For example, in a set of 10 data points and threshold value of 40, all but the top 4 data points will get merged.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.ThresholdMode.PercentageValue
member.summary: The threshold value should be a decimal or integer number between 0 and 100 and represents a percentage of the summary value of all data points. Once the absolute threshold value gets calculated all data points having value less than it get merged. For example, in a set of 10 data points with values from 1 to 10, the summary value is 55. If the threshold value is 10, it means the absolute threshold value is 55 * 10% = 5.5 . This means that all data points with value smaller than 5.5 will get merged.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.ThresholdMode.Value
member.summary: The threshold value should be a decimal or integer number representing the minimum value that a data point should have in order to get presented on its own (not getting merged). All data points having value less than the threshold value get merged. For example, in a set of 10 data points with values from 1 to 10, if the threshold value is 8.5, all data points having value less than 8.5 will get merged.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Group
member.summary: Represents a class that defines a report group.

remarks.para: The Group class represents a set of grouping criteria. It also acts as a logical holder of the and of the group.
The Group objects of a report reside in the component tray.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.GroupKeepTogether
member.summary: Set to FirstDetail to ensure that the group header and the first detail record are printed on the same page of output, or All to ensure that the entire group is printed on the same page of output. If there is not enough space on the current page, then rendering will skip to the top of the next page.
member.remarks: When set to All, the PageBreak settings of the internal report sections get neglected and no soft page breaks get produced.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.GroupHeader
member.summary: Gets a representing the group's header section.
member.value: A value that represents the group header section of the Group.

remarks.para: The Group header section is rendered before the detail sections of the Group. Typically, this section will contain report items that are bound to the data fields of the Group's grouping expressions.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.GroupFooter
member.summary: Gets a representing the group's footer section.
member.value: A value that represents the group footer section of the Group.

remarks.para: The Group footer section is rendered after the detail sections of the Group.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.Report
member.summary: Gets a representing the group's owner report.
member.value: A value that represents the owner report of the Group.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.BookmarkId
member.summary: Gets or sets a bookmark id for this group.
member.value: A started with "=" is interpreted as an expression to calculate the resulting id, otherwise - literal string. Supports embedded expressions also. When processed should evaluate to an unique value for each processing instance of the group. Any duplicated occurrences at runtime get modified in order to avoid duplication in the resulting report.
member.remarks: BookmarkId must be used along with interactive action in order to specify the target of the action.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Group.DocumentMapText
member.summary: Gets or sets a text to be displayed for this group in the document map.
member.remarks: When defined the document map displays nodes that navigate to the instances of the group.
member.value: A started with "=" is interpreted as an expression to calculate the real data, otherwise - literal string. Supports embedded expressions also.

member.summary: Gets or sets a text to be displayed for this group in the table of contents.
member.remarks: When defined the table of contents displays nodes that navigate to the instances of the group.
member.value: A started with "=" is interpreted as an expression to calculate the real data, otherwise - literal string. Supports embedded expressions also.

member.summary: Represents a group footer section. Group footers are displayed at the end of a group. Group headers and footers are unified by the class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GroupFooterSection.PrintAtBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the rendering engine should print the section at the bottom of the page that contains the section.
member.value: A boolean value indicating whether the rendering engine should print the section at the bottom of the page that contains the section.
member.remarks: When false, the section will be printed right after the preceeding section. When true, the section will be printed at the bottom of the page that contains the section. All subsequent sections will be moved on the next page. If there is no preceeding section on the page, the section will print on the top of the page.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.GroupFooterSection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.GroupKeepTogether
member.summary: GroupKeepTogether applies to a group and has similar to the meaning, but for the whole group. It indicates whether the rendering engine should try to render the whole group on a single page, the group header plus the first detail on a single page, or leave the group flow as it is. If GroupKeepTogether is set to FirstDetail -- the group header and at least one detail in this group should be on the same page; if set to All -- the whole group should be on a single page. The following rule applies: the rendering engine will try to render the group as specified, but if there is not enough space on the current page, the group is moved to the next page and it continues as long as it needs.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.GroupKeepTogether.None
member.summary: The rendering engine will leave the group flow as it is.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.GroupKeepTogether.FirstDetail
member.summary: The rendering engine should try to keep the group header and at least 1 detail on the same page.

member.name: F:Telerik.Reporting.GroupKeepTogether.All
member.summary: The rendering engine should try to keep the whole group on the same page. This value has higher priority compared with the PageBreak property of the contained report sections.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the parameter. Used to access the parameter.
member.remarks: Parameter names must be unique in the context of a single report. The name must be a valid identifier - may contain only digits (0-9), letters (a-z, A-Z), and underscore sign (_). Must begin with a letter or underscore.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the data type of the parameter.
member.remarks: Determines the type of the values. Acceptable values for each type are listed in . The default parameter type is .

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the parameter. Can be an Expression that evaluates to an object, value of the allowed types, or containing values of the allowed types.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.Mergeable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this parameter should be merged with identical parameters from other reports when this report is part of a .
member.remarks: Controls parameter merging in . The default value of the Mergeable property is true. Set the Mergeable property to false if you want to prevent a parameter from being merged with its equivalent ones.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for the parameter's automatic UI displayed in the report viewer.
member.remarks: The Text property specifies the text for the parameter to be displayed in the report viewer as prompt to the end user. If value for the property is not provided the of the parameter is used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.Visible
member.summary: Determines whether automatic user interface (UI) prompting for values to be generated for the parameter.
member.remarks: Specifies whether the parameter will have UI in the parameters area. When at least one report parameter has the Visible property turned on, a parameter area is shown as part of the report viewer. If this property is set to false, the parameter must be populated programmatically or at design time.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.MultiValue
member.summary: Determines if the parameter can hold more then one value.
member.remarks: If the value is set to true as a valid value of the parameter is accepted or of values of the specified of the parameter. Parameters with MultiValue turned on are mainly used with the IN logical operator.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.AllowNull
member.summary: Determines if the parameter allows no value to be passed from it's editor.
member.remarks: Only if this property is set to false null ( Nothing in VB) are considered as valid values of the parameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.AllowBlank
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an empty string is a valid value for the parameter. Only for parameters of String.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.AvailableValues
member.summary: Gets an object that defines a set of valid values the parameter can accept from.
member.remarks: The available values, or valid values, are a set of predefined values which are acceptable as value of the parameter. Each available value may have label that will be displayed if the parameter is visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.IReportParameter.AutoRefresh
member.summary: Determines whether to trigger the report preview after changing the value for a parameter. Applies only for visible parameters.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the report viewer will trigger the report preview automatically when the parameter value is changed. The parameter should be visible in order to auto preview the report.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.BingLocationProvider
member.summary: A class used to match the addresses or locations with geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude) using the Bing Maps REST API. /// Requires a valid Bing Maps Key that could be obtained from "http://www.microsoft.com/maps/create-a-bing-maps-key.aspx"
member.remarks: The more detailed information is used in the query, the more accurate the results will be.
For example, if you are looking for Vienna, Austria, you need to provide the country name as well, because otherwise the first returned result would be Vienna, VA, United States
Bing Maps geocoding service is able to determine the relation between the query arguments - i.e. the results will be the same if you search for either "Vienna, Austria" or "Austria, Vienna"

member.summary: An abstract class for all the web-based location service providers

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.MapQuestLocationProvider
member.summary: A class used to match the addresses or locations with geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude) using the MapQuest Licensed Geocoding API. Requires a valid MapQuest AppKey that could be obtained from "http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open"
member.remarks: The more detailed information is used in the query, the more accurate the results will be.
For example, if you are looking for Vienna, Austria, you need to provide the country name as well, because otherwise the first returned result would be Vienna, GA, United States
Please note that the query arguments order is of a huge significance.
In the example above if you switch the query arguments to "Austria, Vienna", the service will return "Vienna, Dooly County, GA, USA"

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.MapQuestOpenAPILocationProvider
member.summary: A class used to match the addresses or locations with geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude) using the MapQuest Open Geocoding API Web Service: http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open/geocoding-service Requires a valid MapQuest AppKey that could be obtained from "http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open"
member.remarks: The more detailed information is used in the query, the more accurate the results will be.
For example, if you are looking for Vienna, Austria, you need to provide the country name as well, because otherwise the first returned result would be Vienna, GA, United States
Please note that the query arguments order is of a huge significance.
In the example above if you switch the query arguments to "Austria, Vienna", the service will return "Vienna, Dooly County, GA, USA"

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.GenericTileProvider
member.summary: A class used to obtain map tiles from any tile server compliant with Web Map Tile Service protocol.
member.remarks: By default, the GenericTileProvider is initialized using the MapQuest tile server properties.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to initialize a GenericTileProvider instance:

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GenericTileProvider.UrlTemplate
member.summary: A templated URL that will be used to fetch the tiles from the tile provider. Valid template patterns are {subdomain}, {x}, {y}, {zoom}.
member.remarks:
The UrlTemplate have the following format:
http://{subdomain}.mqcdn.com/tiles/1.0.0/map/{zoom}/{x}/{y}.jpg
The {subdomain} tag marks the place where a subdomain from the collection would be placed. This tag is not mandatory, since the selected tile provider may not offer more than one subdomain.
The {zoom} tag will be replaced by the calculated zoom level (level of details) of the current tile set.
The {x} and {y} tags are used as a placeholders for the tile position.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GenericTileProvider.UrlSubdomains
member.summary: Set of subdomains that will replace the {subdomain} tag in the . When more than one subdomain is specified, the tile requests will be distributed evenly among the subdomains.
member.remarks:
For example, for MapQuest Tile server the subdomains are:
otile1, otile2, otile3, otile4

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GenericTileProvider.Attribution
member.summary: The Attribution property must be set manually according to the tile provider usage policy. This text will be displayed in the lower right corner of the map area.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.GenericTileProvider.LogoUrl
member.summary: The LogoUrl property denotes the URL used to download the tile provider logo, if required by the provider's usage policy. In case the URL points to a valid image, it will be displayed in the lower left corner of the map area.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.ReportFooterSection
member.summary: Represents a report footer section. Report footer is displayed at the end of a report, but before the last if any.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportFooterSection.PrintAtBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the rendering engine should print the section at the bottom of the page that contains the section.
member.value: A boolean value indicating whether the rendering engine should print the section at the bottom of the page that contains the section.
member.remarks: When false, the section will be printed right after the preceeding section. When true, the section will be printed at the bottom of the page that contains the section. All subsequent sections will be moved on the next page. If there is no preceeding section on the page, the section will print on the top of the page.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.ReportHeaderSection

remarks.para: If you do not want a displayed on the first page set the property to false.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem
member.summary: Defines the base class for all report items that can be placed in a . Items of this type have a location and a size.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the height and width of the report item.
member.value: The that represents the height and width of the report item in Units.
member.remarks: Because the SizeU class is a value type (Structure in Visual Basic, struct in Visual C#), it is returned by value, meaning accessing the property returns a copy of the size of the report item. So, adjusting the or properties of the SizeU returned from this property will not affect the or of the report item. To adjust the Width or Height of the report item, you must set the item's Width or Height property, or set the Size property with a new SizeU.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the report item relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
member.value: The that represents the upper-left corner of the report item relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
member.remarks: Because the PointU class is a value type (Structure in Visual Basic, struct in Visual C#), it is returned by value, meaning accessing the property returns a copy of the upper-left point of the report item. So, adjusting the or properties of the PointU returned from this property will not affect the , , , or property values of the report item. To adjust these properties set each property value individually, or set the Location property with a new PointU.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem.Anchoring
member.summary: Gets or sets the edges of the container to which a report is bound and determines how a report items is resized with its parent.
member.value: A bitwise combination of the values. The default is .

remarks.para: Use the Anchoring property to define how a report is automatically resized as its parent item is resized. Anchoring a report to its parent ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent when the parent control is resized.

You can anchor a report item to one or more edges of its container. For example, if you have a DetailSection with a TextBox whose Anchoring property value is set to Top and Bottom, the TextBox is stretched to maintain the anchored distance to the top and bottom edges of the DetailSection as the Height of the DetailSection is increased.
Note:The Anchoring and properties are mutually exclusive. Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem.Docking
member.summary: Gets or sets which report item borders are docked to its parent and determines how a report item is resized with its parent.
member.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.para: Use the Docking property to define how a report is automatically resized as its parent is resized. For example, setting Docking to causes the report item to align itself with the bottom edges of its parent and to resize as the parent is resized.
A report item can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container.
Note:The and Docking properties are mutually exclusive. Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItem.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the size and location of the report item including its nonclient elements, in Units, relative to the parent report item.
member.value: A relative to the parent report item that represents the size and location of the report item including its nonclient elements.
member.remarks: The bounds of the report item include the nonclient elements such as borders and padding.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance, in Units, between the left edge of the report item and the left edge of its container's client area.
member.value: An representing the distance between the left edge of the report item and the left edge of its container's client area.

remarks.para: The Left property value is equivalent to the property of the property value of the report item.
Changes made to the and Left property values cause the property value of the report item to change.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItemBase.CanParent(System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates whether an object of the specified type can be a direct child of this item.
member.param: The type to check.
member.returns: true if an object of the specified type can be a direct child of this item, otherwise false.
member.remarks: If an item cannot contain an object of a given type, then it cannot parent it as well. If an item cannot parent an object of a given type, this does not mean that it cannot contain it. For example, a Report cannot directly parent a TextBox, but it can contain a TextBox.

member.summary: Indicates whether this item can contain an object of the specified type.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.ReportItemBase.CanBeAncestorOf(Telerik.Reporting.ReportItemBase)
member.summary: Indicates whether this can be an ancestor of the specified item. THIS OBJECT CAN BE AN ANCESTOR OF THE SPECIFIED ITEM WHEN IT CAN CONTAIN THE TYPE OF THE ITEM AND ALL OF ITS DESCENDANTS.
member.param: The to check.
member.returns: true if this can be an ancestor of the specified item, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Invalid ancestor-descendant relationships may occur even if the direct parent-child relation (as indicated by the CanParent method) is OK, but the item hierarchy as a whole is not OK (as indicated by the CanContain method). For example, a PageSection can have a Panel as a direct child and a Panel can have a SubReport as a direct child (as indicated by the CanParent method), but if we add a Panel with a SubReport in it to a PageSection we will break the rule that PageSections cannot be ancestors of SubReports (CanContain method).

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.Type

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.Mergeable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this parameter should be merged with identical parameters from other reports when this report is part of a .
member.remarks: Controls parameter merging in . The default value of the Mergeable property is true. Set the Mergeable property to false if you want to prevent a parameter from being merged with its equivalent ones.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for the parameter's automatic UI displayed in the report viewer. Can be an Expression that evaluates to a string.
member.remarks: The Text property specifies the text for the parameter to be displayed in the report viewer as prompt to the end user. If value for the property is not provided the of the parameter is used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.Visible
member.summary: Determines whether automatic user interface (UI) prompting for values to be generated for the parameter.
member.remarks: Specifies whether the parameter will have UI in the parameters area. When at least one report parameter has the Visible property turned on, a parameter area is shown as part of the report viewer. If this property is set to false, the parameter must be populated programmatically or at design time.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.MultiValue
member.summary: Determines if the parameter can hold more then one value.
member.remarks: If the value is set to true as a valid value of the parameter is accepted or of values of the specified of the parameter. Parameters with MultiValue turned on are mainly used with the IN logical operator.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.AllowNull
member.summary: Determines if the parameter allows no value to be passed from it's editor.
member.remarks: Only if this property is set to false null ( Nothing in VB) are considered as valid values of the parameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.AllowBlank
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an empty string is a valid value for the parameter. Only for parameters of String.

member.summary: Gets an object that defines a set of valid values the parameter can accept from.
member.remarks: The available values, or valid values, are a set of predefined values which are acceptable as value of the parameter. Each available value may have label that will be displayed if the parameter is visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.ReportParameter.AutoRefresh
member.summary: Determines whether to trigger the report preview after changing the value for a parameter. Applies only for visible parameters.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the report viewer will trigger the report preview automatically when the parameter value is changed. The parameter should be visible in order to auto preview the report.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Table
member.summary: The table report item displays detail data, data organized in row groups, or both.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Table.RowGroups
member.summary: Table row groups hierarchy. (Optional) Table row groups are located on the lower-left corner. This area is automatically created when you add a row group. Cells in this area represent members of the row groups hierarchy, and display row group instance values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Table.ColumnGroups
member.summary: Table column group hierarchy. (Optional) Table column groups are located in the upper-right corner. This area is automatically created when you add a column group. Cells in this area represent members of the column groups hierarchy, and display the column group instance values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Table.Body
member.summary: Table body area. (Optional) The Table body is located in the lower right corner. The Table body displays detail and grouped data. The scope for the expression is determined by the innermost groups to which the text box belongs. Cells in the Table body display detail data when they are members of a detail row and they represent aggregate data when they are members of a row or column associated with a group. By default, cells in a group row or column that contain simple expressions that do not include an aggregate function, evaluate to the first value in the group.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Table.Corner
member.summary: Table corner area. (Optional) A Table corner is located in the upper-left corner. This area is automatically created when you add both row groups and column groups to a Table item. In this area, you can merge cells and add a label or embed another report item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.TableGroup.BookmarkId
member.summary: Gets or sets a bookmark id for this group.
member.value: A started with "=" is interpreted as an expression to calculate the resulting id, otherwise - literal string. Supports embedded expressions also. When processed should evaluate to an unique value for each processing instance of the group. Any duplicated occurrences at runtime get modified in order to avoid duplication in the resulting report.
member.remarks: BookmarkId must be used along with interactive action in order to specify the target of the action.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Rtf.Cell.CellDef.PrepareMerging
member.summary:
This method adds merging information to the cell depending on several factors. Here is a simple example of a 3x3 merged range:
With RTF control words: |------|------|------| |clmgf |clmrg |clmrg | |clvmgf|clvmgf|clvmgf| |------|------|------| |clmgf |clmrg |clmrg | |clvmrg|clvmrg|clvmrg| |------|----- |------| |clmgf |clmrg |clmrg | |clvmrg|clvmrg|clvmrg| |------|----- |------|
Legend: HM = Horizontal Master VM = Vertical Master HS = Horizontal Slave VS = Vertical Slave |------|------|------| |HM |HS |HS | |VM |VM |VM | |------|------|------| |HM |HS |HS | |VS |VS |VS | |------|----- |------| |HM |HS |HS | |VS |VS |VS | |------|----- |------|

member.summary: Converts mm to twips. 1in = 72pt = 1440twips 1in = 2.54cm = 25.4mm 1mm = 1440/25.4
member.param: The amount in points.
member.returns: The amount in twips.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Rtf.Destination
member.summary: Certain control words, referred to as destinations, mark the beginning of a collection of related text that could appear at another position, or destination, within the document. Destinations may also be text that is used (but should not appear) within the document at all. Destinations added after the RTF Specification published in the March 1987 Microsoft Systems Journal may be preceded by the control symbol \* (backslash asterisk). This control symbol identifies destinations whose related text should be ignored if the RTF reader does not recognize the destination control word. (RTF writers should follow the convention of using this control symbol when adding new destinations or groups.) Destinations whose related text should be inserted into the document even if the RTF reader does not recognize the destination should not use \*. All destinations that were not included in the March 1987 revision of the RTF Specification are shown with \* as part of the control word.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.Engine.CacheFactory.CreateDatabaseCache(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates new instance of database cache that will store cached data in a database.
member.param: Specifies which database engine should be used.
A connection string that should be used to connect to the cache database
member.returns: The newly created cache instance.
member.remarks:
In order to use a database cache you should firstly use the Database Cache Configuration Tool in order to create the underplaying database and its schema.
Note that the database cache implementation relies on the Telerik OpenAccess so the following OpenAccess core libraries should be referenced: Telerik.OpenAccess.dll, Telerik.OpenAccess.35.Extensions.dll . Proper assembly binding redirects might apply.
See also: Configuring the Database Cache Provider

member.summary: Represents a thread-safe (synchronized) in-memory generic Queue that automatically processes the contained items using a user-supplied delegate. Note that while traditional use of the Queue (using Enqueue and Dequeue) will behave as expected, using more than one thread for processing removes any guarantee of the order in which queued items are processed.

The number of worker threads to create.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration.HostAppId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique constant name of the application hosting the reports service.
member.remarks: When not set the report service utilizes the AppDomainSetup.ApplicationName Property for the current application domain. This however is not sufficient for each application setup. Set a value for this property in order to provide an unique name among all apps implementing the report service that will be deployed in the same environment.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the count of the worker threads that render the report documents.
member.remarks: By default the worker threads count is equal to the count of the available logical processors on the machine.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration.ClientSessionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value in minutes indicating how long a client session will be preserved in the service storage after the last interaction from this client.
member.remarks: The value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration.ReportSharingTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value in minutes indicating how long a rendered report document from a client will be viable for reuse on subsequent document requests from the same or other clients.
member.remarks: The value must be greater or equal to zero. A zero value will prevent rendered report document reuse.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration.Storage
member.summary: Gets or sets an implementation instance that will be used for internal storage from the report service.
member.remarks: Use this property setter in order to provide a storage instance. May be one of the built-in storage implementations or a custom implementation. This is mandatory setting without defaults.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration.ReportResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets an implementation instance that will be used for report resolving from the service.
member.remarks: Use this property setter in order to provide a report resolver instance. May be one of the built-in report resolvers or a custom implementation resolver. Built-in resolvers may be chained. This is mandatory setting without defaults.
